main event: On 19 June 1949, three unidentified flying objects were observed over Oak Ridge, Tennessee at approximately 1200 hours.
interesting points: The objects included two rectangular-shaped objects moving in a wave-like motion and a circular object at a higher altitude,The rectangular objects were described as having a bright metallic finish on top and dark underneath,The third object was compared to the color of frosted glass,The sighting lasted for about 12 to 15 minutes,Local weather reports confirmed no balloons were released on that day.
sighted object: two rectangular objects and one circular object
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. [REDACTED], a school teacher, and the wife of a member of the Security Division, AEC
